title: Is a right angle triangle a scalene triangle? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Only sometimes, still, no doubt, It’s hard to see, it all works out” A scalene triangle is a triangle that has three unequal sidesA right-angle triangle is a triangle in which one angle is a right angle A right-angle triangle says nothing specifically about line lengths of the lines. So obvious;ly a right-angle triangle is also a scalene triangle. Unless it isn’t. Of course, that’s hardly surprising. Nearly every triangle is a scalene triangle. It’s almost like saying every honey bee is a worker,. Unless it isn’t. So what are the alternatives? I can think of isosceles triangles and equatorial triangles. Obviously no equilateral triangle can be a right-angled triangle, since you can’t have three right angles in a triangle, at least not in Euclidean geometry. How about an isosceles triangle? Can a right-angled triangle also be isosceles? Only if you can find a way to make a triangle with a right angle and two equal sides. There’s gotta be a way….

No. Right triangle has one 90 degree and two 45 degree angles. And that means two angles are the same size. Scalene triangle is a triangle where no angles are the same and al of the sides are different lengt. For example you have triangle with 60, 40 and 80 degree angle. So if i put it together - Right triangle has 2 angles the same size and scalene triangle has all the angles in different sizes.
